prisonescape.game.util
Class Time

java.lang.Object
  prisonescape.game.util.Time

public class Time
extends java.lang.Object

A class for the manipulation of time within the game. Credit for structure of class and some methods: https://github.com/jonbonazza/akatsuki/blob/master/src/akatsuki/Time.java

Since:
1.0
Version:
1.0
Author:
Sam Ward

Provides the complete current date and time information.

isDay

public boolean isDay()
Finds whether it is currently daytime or not.

Returns:
True if it is daytime, or false if it is nighttime.

setTime

public static Time setTime(java.util.Calendar cal,
                           int hour,
                           int minute)
Sets the time forward to the first occurrence of the exact hour and minute provided.

Parameters:
cal - The current time and date information.
hour - The hour to advance to.
minute - The minute to advance to.
Returns:
A Time object with the first occurrence of the given hour and minute after the calendar provided.

getTime

public static Time getTime(java.util.Calendar cal,
                           int scale)
Advances the time based on a given time scale and the last time the method was called.

Parameters:
cal - The current time and date information.
scale - The scale to advance time by (scale = gameTime/realWorldTime).
Returns:
The new Time.

getTime

public static Time getTime(java.util.Calendar cal)
Provides the current time in the game.

Parameters:
cal - The current time and date information.
Returns:
The current Time object.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns the current time as a string that can be used.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
Time in string format hh:mm.

getTint

public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color getTint()
Provides a colour tint to be used over the map depending on the time of day that it is.

Returns:
A colour tint.

updateLastTime

public static void updateLastTime()
Updates the last time called to the current time. Can be used to reset the amount that would be added when getTime(Calendar cal, int scale) is called.
